page.title: 04Housing in Wrea Green (p.2)
page.content:
This house is large and includes a squash court, pool room and basement.
Another house which is unusual is shaped like a windmill. This once was a real windmill but the roof collapsed so it stood empty for many years. This house featured on television last year as it was being altered.
The head girl of the school lives in a three hundred year old cottage opposite the church which once was thatched but now has a corrugated roof.
Another pupil at the school lives in a cottage at Westby belonging to the largest farm in our area.
